DOC.HEAD: Names in the News
LaserPhoto NY14
DOC.TEXT: Country music star Clint Black said he got the audience at Carnegie Hall in New York to loosen up at a recent concert, but there was one small snag. the crowd at the stately concert hall seemed to enjoy his singing and made it seem ``like Austin on a Saturday night,'' he said. One man even left a note on the window of his private bus that was parked on the street just outside Carnegie Hall. It read: ``Yo, Clint, loved the show.'' One problem though: The man was a city policeman, and he also left behind a ticket for illegal parking, Black told The Dallas Morning News in an interview published Friday. Black is the first country male artist in 15 years to have his debut single reach the No. 1 spot. His third single, ``Nobody's Home,'' was released in November.

Chemists B. Stanley Pons and Martin Fleischmann, who concocted a controversial cold fusion experiment in a kitchen, are at it again. This time, the results won't be questioned. Neither will they be the subject of a new race to harness the power of the sun and stars. Pons and Fleischmann, who earlier this year rocked the scientific community with claims they'd achieved a sustained fusion reaction in a flask, annually turn their attention from laboratory research to the kitchen. The menu at their holiday open house this year consisted of nearly 60 different foods and beverages. The offerings included tortellini in sausage pesto; antipasto misto; pate with green peppercorns and truffles; and avocado-lemon mousse. Fleischmann said he looks ``askance at a scientist who doesn't like to cook. Chemists, on the whole, take up cooking as a hobby. Some study history or music, but I'd say cooking is the first choice.''

The daughter of Mayor Tom Bradley has been charged with drunken driving and faces up to a year in jail if convicted, an official said. Phyllis Bradley, 44, was charged Thursday with driving under the influence and driving with a blood alcohol content of more than .10 percent following her arrest on Dec. 15, said Mike Qualls, a spokesman for the city attorney's office. Bradley has a history of drug and alcohol abuse and has been convicted of drunken driving before. Because of her prior conviction, she faces a maximum sentence of one year in county jail, a fine of $1,000 and five years probation, Qualls said. The minimum term is 48 hours in jail, he said. Bradley was stopped by police in Los Angeles after making an illegal U-turn. In a statement after her arrest, Ms. Bradley acknowledeged having been arrested for such offenses in the past and didn't contest the police allegation. The mayor has declined to comment on his daughter's arrest. She is scheduled to be arraigned Jan. 5, Qualls said.

Chinese pingpong star Jiao Zhimin married a South Korean national pingpong player in an opulent traditional Korean wedding ceremony at Olympic Park. Zhimin, 25, of China wed Ahn Jae-hyung, 24, on Friday, celebrating the end of a five-year courtship started after the two met at an international pingpong tournament in Pakistan in 1984. They had married in a civil ceremony in Stockholm last month. The wedding procession included musicians playing flutes. The bride was carried on attendants' shoulders in a litter and the groom led the procession on a pony. Jiao covered her face from the groom during the ceremony, as is tradition, and bowed many times toward her new husband. On the wedding table beside candles and fruit, a live rooster and hen clucked quietly, wrapped in cloth as a symbol of matrimonial harmony. The two have said their love bloomed despite language difficulties, bureaucratic problems and the lack of diplomatic relations between their two nations. They plan to live in Seoul. Ahn was the bronze medalist in the men's doubles in the 1988 Summer Olympics in Seoul and Jiao won the silver in women's doubles and a bronze medal in singles.
